p: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious bacterial disease commonly affecting the lungs. Coughing, sneezing or spitting can help facilitate the transfer of mycobacterium tuberculosis from person to person. It no longer appears in the list of the top ten causes of Global DALYs, largely because it is so linked to AIDS. TB is an AIDS related opportunistic infection and may not be recorded separately. In 2013, nine million people developed TB and over 1.5 million died, of which 300,000 were HIV+ (WHO 2014c). TB accounts for 25% of all HIV-related deaths.
